snippet.title: Analysts think next year's Galaxy Note will be Samsung's first device with a fingerprint reader inside the display
snippet.content:
A new note by KGI Securities (which ) suggests that Samsung may not introduce a fingerprint scanner that's built under the display before the Galaxy Note 9 is unveiled, likely some time in the second half of next year.
A few weeks from now, the Korean giant is going to , and if the company's schedule remains unchanged, we can expect to see a Galaxy S9 between February and April next year. KGI's note suggests that neither of these phones will come with the new technology.
The Galaxy S8 removed the physical home button that was used by all Galaxy devices before it. It also moved the fingerprint reader to the back in . That , however, as the company was reportedly trying to get the scanner to work from underneath the device's front panel.
Samsung eventually discarded the idea entirely and adopted a last-minute solution (the reader on the back), which as well. And KGI's note says the Galaxy S9 will also favour other features and leave the Note 9 to introduce the built-in scanner.
Apple was reportedly looking into under the screen for its upcoming tenth anniversary iPhone too. However, it ultimately , and focus its efforts solely on which should be able to work in a number of situations, and .
"OLED iPhone has cancelled under-display fingerprint recognition/Touch ID function, and Galaxy S9 will have the new selling points of upgraded iris recognition and dual camera," says KGI's note. "Samsung has no need to risk adopting under-display optical fingerprint solution in a hurry."
